DOC.brief_summary: This study design assess safety efficacy intravitreal injection Conbercept visual acuity anatomic outcome patient diabetic macular edema ( DME ) .
DOC.brief_title: Safety Efficacy Study Conbercept Diabetic Macular Edema ( DME ) ( Sailing )
DOC.criteria: 1 . Patients sign inform consent , willing able comply followup ; 2 . Age ≥ 18 year , gender ; 3 . Diagnosis type 1 type 2 diabetes mellitus ; 4 . Serum HbA1c ≤ 10 % ; 5 . Study eye must meet following criterion : Visual acuity impairment cause DME involve foveal ; BCVA score ≥ 24 ≤ 73 Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study ( ETDRS ) letter 4 meter/1 meter ETDRS test ( Equivalent Snellen chart 20/40 20/320 ) ; Visual impairment due Choroidal Neovascularization ( CNV ) secondary high myopia . Central retinal thickness ( CRT ) ≥300μm ( spectral domain Optical Coherence Tomography ( OCT ) , CRT measurement must confirm central reading center ) ; Refractive medium opacity miosis effect fundus examination . 6 . Nonstudy eye BCVA ≥ 24 letter ( equivalent Snellen visual acuity 20/320 ) . 1 . Active infectious ocular inflammation either eye ; 2 . Proliferative diabetic retinopathy ( PDR ) study eye , exception inactive , regress PDR ; 3 . Any ocular disorder study eye may cause macular edema exclude diabetic retinopathy ; 4 . Iris neovascularization study eye ; 5 . Uncontrolled glaucoma , history glaucoma surgery ; 6 . Aphakia study eye ; 7 . History vitrectomy study eye ; 8 . History panretinal laser photocoagulation ( PRP ) study eye 6 month prior screen , possibly need panretinal photocoagulation study eye study ; 9 . Liver , kidney dysfunction ; 10 . History allergic reaction fluorescein , protein agent diagnosis therapy , 2 drug nondrug factor , concomitant allergic disease .
